perturbation.original_text: 7.2 Termination (a) Should either Party fail to observe faithfully and materially perform each of the material obligations assumed by it in this IP Agreement for thirty (30) days after its attention has been directed to any such breach by notice in writing from the other Party, the non-breaching Party shall, at its option, have the right to terminate the license granted by it under this Agreement, such termination to be effected by serving notice in writing upon the breaching Party to that effect on or after the expiration of such period of thirty (30) days.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.2 Termination (a) Should either Party fail to observe faithfully and materially perform each of the material obligations assumed by it in this IP Agreement for thirty (30) days after its attention has been directed to any such breach by notice in writing from the other Party, the non-breaching Party shall, at its option, have the right to terminate the license granted by it under this Agreement, such termination to be effected by serving notice in writing upon the breaching Party to that effect immediately after such breach.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the termination timeframe. The original clause requires a 30-day notice period for the breaching party to remedy the breach before termination can be effected. The modified clause allows for immediate termination upon breach, creating uncertainty about the required notice period.

perturbation.original_text: 8.12 Transferability All Transferred Patents will be fully transferable, alienable or licensable by PURCHASER from and after the Closing without restriction and without payment of any kind to any third party other than requirements under applicable laws to file documents with and pay fees to patent offices. There are no Liens on any of the Transferred Patents. (For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties acknowledge that SONY's licensees under Portfolio Cross Licenses already hold licenses to the Transferred Patents and do not need a license from PURCHASER to practice the Transferred Patents.)
perturbation.changed_text: 8.12 Transferability All Transferred Patents will be fully transferable, alienable or licensable by PURCHASER from and after the Closing subject to SONY's prior written approval, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. There are no Liens on any of the Transferred Patents. (For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties acknowledge that SONY's licensees under Portfolio Cross Licenses already hold licenses to the Transferred Patents and do not need a license from PURCHASER to practice the Transferred Patents.)
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a requirement for SONY's approval for transferability, contradicting the earlier statement that the Transferred Patents will be fully transferable without restriction. This creates uncertainty about the PURCHASER's ability to freely transfer the patents.

perturbation.original_text: 9.3 Successors and Assigns This IP Agreement will be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto and their respective successors and permitted assigns, but will not be assignable or delegable by any Party without the prior written consent of the other Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Party may transfer or assign its rights under this IP Agreement in connection with a merger, acquisition or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, on condition that it provides the 14 other Party with notice of the transfer or assignment. Any attempted transfer in contravention of this Section 9.3 shall be null and void.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.3 Successors and Assigns This IP Agreement will be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto and their respective successors and permitted assigns, but will not be assignable or delegable by any Party. Any attempted transfer in contravention of this Section 9.3 shall be valid. Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Party may transfer or assign its rights under this IP Agreement in connection with a merger, acquisition or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, on condition that it provides the 14 other Party with notice of the transfer or assignment.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces contradiction. The original text mentions that any transfer in contravention of this section shall be null and void but the changed text mentions it shall be valid. This brings uncertainty about the transferability of the agreement.
